alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 02 at 10:45PM CDT until August 05 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Bourbeuse River at Union. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bourbeuse River at Union. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flat Creek backs up to Smeltzer`s Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 15.7 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Bourbeuse River Union 15.0 10.6 15.4 12.3 9.3 4.7 3.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
